name: Holiday Inn Bloor Yorkville

reviews.text: We stayed in this hotel for both business and pleasure. The location is terrific, close to everything we wanted. There are playgrounds nearby, a gym you can use through the hotel with a swimming pool, great museums, the university campus and restaurants. We had a great time. The bar and restaurant downstairs were not so great. I would avoid those. The staff was helpful and child friendly. The room was clean but on the small side. There is a little deli right across the street that picked up snacks at and breakfast. It was clean. There was a parking garage in the basement. The streets are very busy at night and the area seemed very safe.
reviews.title: Great Experience in Toronto
Consistently fine
reviews.text: I have stayed at the Holiday Inn Midtown about 30 times over the past 5 years and my most recent visit was over the long weekend in early August. I travel to Toronto frequently for both pleasure and business. The location is terrific: close to shopping and the subway, and there are plenty of restaurants to choose from in the lively Bloor and Spadina area. (On the other hand, there are plenty of homeless people on the streets in this area, which means you are liable to be bothered for change every time you walk down Bloor.) The price for a room is very competitve given this hotel's downtown location. Check-in is always speedy and the long-time staff recognize me when I arrive, which is nice. I also like the parking garage: you don't need to take a ticket and there is always room on the first level (yes, at $22 a day, it is pricey, but everything in pricey in Toronto). For breakfast, I avoid the cafe connected to the lobby and head to Tim Hortons which is just down the street. The hotel has been refurbished over the years and my room is always clean. In 30 visits, I have never been bothered with noise from other guests. All in all, you can't go wrong at the Holiday Inn Midtown.

Stayed there on friday and Saturday nites in July. The location couldn't have been better- about 2 blocks from the Royal Ontario Museum. 1/2 block from the subway entrance. Plenty of restaurants & shops in the area. University is just south of the hotel (1/2 block).
reviews.title: really can't find anything wrong

reviews.text: Hotel was clean and comfortable. Only shortcoming is that there is no pool or hot tub nor is there a free breakfast. Take a tip from us and don't use the hotel parking as it was $22 per nite. just around the corner is public parking for $12 per 24 hours.
reviews.title: Back again

reviews.text: Staff was nice too!
reviews.title: Great location for University of Toronto visitors

reviews.text: I've stayed at the Holiday Inn Midtown twice now, first in 2005 and again in August 2007.
reviews.title: Great location and value

reviews.text: It's a nice, comfortable hotel. Nothing spectacular as far as the rooms or lobby or anything goes, but a clean and comfortable place to stay.
reviews.title: Great Stay! Amazing hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What really makes it a great place is the location. It's right at Bloor & St. George, next to the U of T campus. So you can quite easily walk either west down Bloor and hit all the spots in the Annex, or east into Yorkville. It's also just across from the St. George subway station, so it's very convenient if you need to get further afield via public transportation.
reviews.title: Excellent value and location, location, location
Reasonably priced, standard hotel - excellent location
reviews.text: Given the location, I find the prices to be quite reasonable. Our room rate on this most recent trip was $136 (CDN), with taxes and parking ($22 a day, but unlimited in/out) it came to around $175. Given that I've paid over $100 before to stay in mediocre hotels up in North York or Markham where it's a good hour plus drive downtown, I can't beat this price. I would certainly stay again and recommend it to anyone traveling to Toronto.

WOW...This hotel is an excellent hotel. I just got back from a 5 night stay with family at this hotel. At first, we were hesitant on booking because we weren't quite sure of where it was in Toronto, and whether or not it was a good hotel. When we got there, we knew we made the right choice. Everything about this hotel is just superb.
reviews.title: tasty Toronto

likes.liked: — The lcoal gym and Bloor Street

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having been to Toronto a number of times in the past, I knew which areas I wanted to stay in - but the challenge was finding a hotel at a good price.
reviews.title: Good Hotel at Good Price in Great Location

likes.disliked: — There was nothing bad about it

reviews.text: The Holiday Inn on Bloor Street did the job perfectly. The reception was OK, the room was OK, but the location was perfect - just 5 or 10 minutes away from Yong St, Bay St and the University.
reviews.title: Comfortable hotel, good location for shopping

reviews.text: I would definitely stay here again - and probably will do on my next trip to Toronto.
reviews.title: Not bad for $ in downtown area

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for three night in sept 07 and found the room to be clean, comfortable and a reasonble size. Being part of a chain it's similar to rooms in any other Holiday Inn.
reviews.title: Not very nice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Daily parking fee was $22 - seemed slightly high but the wifi was free in the rooms (and there's a couple of computers for customer use in the lobby too).
reviews.title: Exceeded Expectations at the Holiday Inn midtown

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Excellent room and extremely helpful service from front desk staff.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, watch out for 'The Express Cafe' downstairs though

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, great value.
reviews.title: The best mid-range hotel in Toronto

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Bad experience at the 'Express Cafe' immediately downstairs though. Although the cafe is not officially part of the hotel, the menu is in the package in your room and the cafe does use the hotel's washrooms. I would advise avoiding this place. When we visited for breakfast, the plastic menus were covered in grease and really old food residue, the tables hadn't been cleaned although it wasn't that busy and there were staff doing nothing behind the counter, and the breakfast itself was the worst I've experienced in Toronto ( half cooked, half cold, inedible). Needless to say, wishing to avoid the possibility of salmonella, we left sharpish.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, excellent location.

reviews.text: I have stayed at the Holiday Inn Midtown twice and I've been to Toronto on four separate occasions overall - this hotel is the best place I have stayed in there. It's in a great location on Bloor Street West, round the corner from the St George subway and opposite the Bata Shoe museum (an fascinating place). It's also in the Annex neighbourhood, which seems quite interesting. And you can walk to the big shops downtown in about 10-15 minutes.
reviews.title: Good location / good stay

reviews.text: The staff at this hotel are really friendly and phoned our room 10 minutes after check-in to make sure everything was OK. The room was quite spacious and felt a comfortable place for an extended stay. We had a couple of chairs and a table and everything was very clean; the furnishings felt solid and the bed was comfy. There's a small fitness room in this hotel (it has a couple of treadmills, bike, cross trainer, TV), and if you prefer a larger gym then they give you free access to a big one down the road. I also like the fact that they support recycling and give you a recycling box alongside your normal bin. I've just come back from a 3-week trip across Canada and the Holiday Inn was one of the only hotels to do this.
reviews.title: reasonably priced hotel near U of T but false fire alarms cause disruption

likes.liked: — clean, centrally located,reasonably priced, near to U of T, free internet

aka: Holiday Inn Bloor Yorkville Hotel Toronto
description: Fashionably located in Toronto's upscale Yorkville area, at the historic University of Toronto, our comfortable rooms, professional staff and superb surroundings make our downtown Toronto hotel an ideal choice for business or leisure. Enjoy walking the tree lined streets to the surrounding museums or use the adjacent subway stop (St. George) to whisk you to your business appointment. Our 209 well appointed rooms ensure that you are well rested to start your Toronto adventure.
